]] A 'surf break' (also 'break', 'shore break', or 'big wave break' {{cite news
 | last = Turner first = Sarah title = The best surf break url = http://www.gua-
 | rdian.co.uk/travel/2006/feb/05/theobserverstop25travelexperiences.watersport-
 | sholidays.observerescapesection accessdate = 2009-04-02 date = 2006-02-05
 | publisher = The Guardian quote = Above all, it's a quality wave, it's
 | reliable, it's a classic big wave break}} ) is a permanent obstruction
 | such as a coral reef, rock, shoal, or headland that causes a wave to
 | break, forming a barreling wave or other wave that can be
 | surfed, before it eventually collapses. The topography of the seabed
 | determines the shape of the wave and type of break. Since shoals can change
 | size and location, affecting the break, it takes commitment and skill to find
 | good breaks. Some surf breaks are quite dangerous, since the surfer can
 | collide with a reef or rocks below the water. Surf breaks are often defended
 | vehemently by surfers. In 2008, surfers and environmentalists opposed a toll
 | road project in Orange County, California that would have changed sediment
 | patterns and affected the world-class Trestles surf break north of San Onofre
 | State Beach which attracted 400,000 surfers in 2007. {{cite
 | news last = Flaccus first = Gillian title = Officials Pick Surf Break Over
 | Toll Road - Local News url =
 | http://www.foxnews.com/wires/2008Feb07/0,4670,TollRoadTussle,00.html
 | accessdate = 2009-04-02 date = 2008-02-07 publisher = Fox News quote =
 | Surfers and environmentalists threw a roadblock in front of a proposed toll
 | road through one of the world's best surf breaks}}

In 2007, the NSW Geographical Names Register began formally recognizing names of
surf breaks in Australia, defining a surf break as a "permanent obstruction such
as a reef, headland, bombora, rock or sandbar, which causes waves to break". {{cite news
 | last = Silmalis first = Linda title = Surf break names recognised url = http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,21520183-
 | 5006007,00.html accessdate = 2009-04-02 publisher = The Daily Telegraph date
 | = 2007-04-08 quote = THE tradition within the surfing community of naming the
 | local break is set to be recognised with the NSW Government to create a
 | formal register}}
